intro: Schomburgkia tibicinis var. exaltata, commonly known as the red-tipped orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red sepals and petals, which contrast beautifully with its green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers bloom in clusters, emitting a subtle fragrance that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly valued in botanical collections and conservation efforts.
